item.title: Doodles of Code
item.description: Here’s a tiny collection of fun, usually unfinished, small weekend toy-projects/hacks. Doodles! Simple, but Useful Tiny tools I’ve actually used on a regular basis at different times: runonchange: just a super bloated inotifywait loop (10x-bloat version of the shell script); mostly used to play with golang. would write it very differently today. Surprisingly Just Works so often that I keep using it. Notes from a lightning talk I gave on this.

item.title: Reads
item.description: Feel free to friend me to chat about SciFi and other good reads at goodreads.com/jzacsh .gr_grid_container { /* customize grid container div here. eg: width: 500px; */ } .gr_grid_book_container { /* customize book cover container div here */ float: left; width: 98px; height: 160px; padding: 0px 0px; overflow: hidden; }

item.title: Sketchbooks & Doodles
item.description: Below are some scanned drawings from a time when I filled multiple new pages per-day in a sketchbook. Some drawings here may also be vector drawings, created in inkscape with a wacom bamboo tablet (eg "nerd friend"). Lastly, I’ve started doodling a bit on the go, in a doodle mobile app I created (eg "burrito riding bicycle"). What’s Shown Here Work shown below is a randomly loaded subset of my scanned work (until I find time to create something nice small screens).
